thread.title: Sergio Aguero held showdown late-night talks in Manchester restaurant with Pep Guardiola over his City future after Gabriel Jesus signing
thread.title_full: Sergio Aguero held showdown late-night talks in Manchester restaurant with Pep Guardiola over his City future after Gabriel Jesus signing

author: rforrester
title: Sergio Aguero held showdown late-night talks in Manchester restaurant with Pep Guardiola over his City future after Gabriel Jesus signing
text:
EFL On Guard Sergio Aguero held showdown late-night talks in Manchester restaurant with Pep Guardiola over his City future after Gabriel Jesus signing 
City unveiled the £27million signing of Jesus on Thursday and will provide serious competition in attack with the Argentinean By Richard Forrester Comments SERGIO AGUERO was involved in late-night showdown talks with boss Pep Guardiola over his Manchester City future. 
The Argentinean is seeking clarity over Guardiola’s vision for the club following the £27million signing of Gabriel Jesus. Reuters 4 Pep Guardiola and Sergio Aguero held showdown talks in a Manchester restaurant 
According to the Daily Mail, Guardiola attempted to keep a low profile at the back of the restaurant as he sat opposite both the striker and his representative. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog. 
The Argentinean has also been dropped several times this campaign including in a Champions League match against Barcelona. Reuters 4 Sergio Aguero lost his cool last month following a late lunge on David Luiz 
His frustrations boiled over when his viscous lunge on Chelsea’s David Luiz earned him a straight red card in the 3-1 defeat last month. 
But with 11 goals in 13 league starts this season, he remains integral to Guardiola’s plans, despite finding the net twice in his last five appearances. PA:Press Association It has been a frustrating few weeks for Sergio Aguero PA:Press Association Images Signing of Gabriel Jesus has means Sergio Aguero now has serious competition for his place in attack related articles When will Spurs' new stadium be finished? Sergio Aguero dangerous red card tackle sparks mass brawl at The Etihad 
But the arrival of the highly-talented Jesus means the 28-year-old's position in the side remains more under threat than ever before. 
Jesus arrives at the Etihad with huge expectations and is expected to play a big part in Guardiola's plans moving forward.
